My question today is......... Did Tsuba makers in the Edo period 
ever 'cas=
t' their work?
I have a Tsuba that appears to have 'cast' marks. I was told=
 that it 
was made in Edo period, the mei is Masahisa, the design of clouds=
 was 
carved or engraved, and in oval shape. I was told it was 'authentic'.=
 I 
have also been told that this tsuba is a cast reproduction. 
I am prepa=
red for any answer I receive. This is all part of my on-going 
education. I=
s this one of the Shiiremono(sp) tourist tsubas?

The pictures have been ad=
ded to my album - numbers 28, 29, 30, & 31.

As always, Thank you again.
